summary: This is a Capital One Platinum MasterCard billing statement for an account ending in 300007C, covering the period December 16, 2016, to January 15, 2017. It shows transactions including airline tickets, retail purchases, and a minimum interest charge, with a billing address in Brooklyn, NY. This document is a Capital One Platinum MasterCard credit card statement for an account ending in 4000, covering the billing period from February 16, 2017, to March 15, 2017. It shows transactions, payments, and a mailing address in Brooklyn, NY. The statement includes routine purchases and travel-related charges. This document contains two billing statements (February-March 2017 and March-April 2017) for a Capital One Platinum MasterCard account ending in 300078. It shows transactions, payments, and interest charges, with purchases at various retail locations and gas stations in New York and Canada. This document contains two consecutive monthly credit card statements (April-May 2017 and May-June 2017) for a Capital One Platinum MasterCard account. The statements show transactions including fuel purchases, Amazon Prime membership, and department store purchases, with payments made to the account. The document appears to be financial evidence from the Epstein case, showing spending patterns and account activity. This document contains two billing statements (May 15-Jun 15, 2017 and Jun 16-Jul 15, 2017) for a Capital One Platinum MasterCard account ending in a specific number. It details transactions including hotel stays, travel, fuel, and retail purchases, along with payments and interest charges. The account is linked to a Brooklyn, NY address. This document contains two consecutive monthly credit card statements (July 16-Aug 15, 2017 and Aug 16-Sep 15, 2017) for a Capital One Platinum MasterCard account ending in 300077, mailed to Brooklyn, NY. It shows transactions, payments, and fees, including purchases at Petland, ExxonMobil, Amazon, and a store in Toronto. The account holder exceeded the credit limit in the first period. This document is a Capital One credit card statement for a Platinum MasterCard account ending in 'MI' or 'IM', covering billing cycles from August to October 2017. It shows transactions, fees, and interest charges, with the account holder's mailing address in Brooklyn, NY. The document includes standard privacy policy and account term disclosures from Capital One. This document is a credit card statement for a Platinum MasterCard account ending in 'MI' for the billing cycle October 16, 2017 to November 15, 2017. It shows transactions including purchases at Rite Aid, McDonald's, an airline ticket, and a jewelry store, along with payments and interest charges. The statement is addressed to an account holder in Brooklyn, NY. This document consists of two consecutive monthly credit card statements (November-December 2017 and December 2017-January 2018) for a Capital One Platinum MasterCard account ending in 'MI'. The statements show transactions, payments, and interest charges, with the billing address in Brooklyn, NY. The document is part of financial records likely subpoenaed for the Epstein case. This document consists of two credit card statements (December 16, 2017 - January 15, 2018 and January 16, 2018 - February 15, 2018) for a Capital One Platinum MasterCard account ending in 'MI'. It details transactions, payments, and fees, showing purchases at various merchants including Amazon, Caron Shoes Boutique, Albany Parking Authority, Petro-Canada, ExxonMobil, University Club, and Walmart. This document contains two consecutive monthly credit card statements (February-March 2018 and March-April 2018) for a Capital One Platinum MasterCard account ending in 'MI'. The statements show transactions, payments, and account details, with the mailing address listed as Brooklyn, NY. The primary transaction of interest is a charge at the University Club in Albany, NY. This document is a Capital One Platinum MasterCard billing statement for an account ending in 'IM', covering the period from April 16, 2018 to May 15, 2018. It shows a transaction at the University Club in Albany, NY, a past due fee, and interest charges. The statement includes a notice of an upcoming increase in the late payment fee. This document is a Capital One Platinum MasterCard credit card statement for the billing period May 16, 2018 to June 15, 2018. It shows a payment due date of July 12, 2018, a new balance of $309.35, and details of payments, interest charges, and account terms. The statement's mailing address is in Brooklyn, NY, and it contains standard credit card terms and conditions. This document is a Capital One Platinum MasterCard billing statement covering June 16, 2018 to July 15, 2018, showing transactions, payments, and interest charges. It is a financial record from the Epstein case document set, though no individuals or case-specific details are mentioned in the provided text. This document contains two credit card statements (July-August 2018 and August-September 2018) for a Capital One Platinum MasterCard account ending in 'MI'. The statements show transactions at various retail stores in Brooklyn, NY, and an online payment to Amazon. The account holder's mailing address is in Brooklyn, NY. This document is a Capital One Platinum MasterCard statement for an account ending in 'MI', covering the billing period from September 16, 2018, to October 15, 2018. It shows transactions including airline tickets from JFK to YYZ (Toronto) and purchases at Burlington Stores in Brooklyn, NY. The statement reveals the account holder's spending patterns and travel during this period. This document contains two credit card statements (October-November 2018 and November-December 2018) for a Capital One Platinum MasterCard account with a billing address in Brooklyn, NY. The statements show transactions primarily for parking in Toronto and Albany, and an Amazon Prime purchase. The account holder is not named in the provided text. This document is a credit card statement for a Capital One Platinum MasterCard account ending in MI, covering the billing period from November 16, 2018, to December 15, 2018. It details transactions including Amazon purchases and JetBlue charges, along with interest and fees.
